\phantomsection\label{index::doc}


Welcome to our API documentation


\chapter{REST API Documentation}
\label{apidoc:welcome-to-day-tripper-s-documentation}\label{apidoc:rest-api-documentation}\label{apidoc::doc}
The DayTripper REST API can be used to interface with the application and its recommendations engine. All requests except those in the auth section require the token query parameter, which is a Facebook OAUTH token that has been previously verified with the DayTripper service. This token is used to both authenticate the user and provide user identity information.


\section{Authentication}
\label{apidoc:authentication}

\section{Itineraries}
\label{apidoc:itineraries}
The itineraries resource represents all itineraries that are currently present in the application.


\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{apidoc:post--itinerary-create}\pysigline{\bfcode{POST~}\bfcode{/itinerary/create}}
Creates an itinerary with the specified parameters. The itinerary will be prefilled with items based on the time and location specified.

\textbf{Request}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{POST} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{itinerary}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{create}
\PYG{n+nx}{Content}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n+nx}{Type}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{n+nx}{application}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{json}

 \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
     \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}city\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{o}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Atlanta\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
     \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}date\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{o}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}2015\PYGZhy{}03\PYGZhy{}31T01:30:53\PYGZhy{}0400\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
     \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}end\PYGZus{}time\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{o}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}2015\PYGZhy{}03\PYGZhy{}31T21:00:53\PYGZhy{}0400\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
     \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}name\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{o}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Sample Itinerary\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
     \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}start\PYGZus{}time\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{o}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}2015\PYGZhy{}03\PYGZhy{}31T10:00:53\PYGZhy{}0400\PYGZdq{}}
  \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{Verbatim}

\textbf{Response}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

  \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}end\PYGZus{}time\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{o}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}2015\PYGZhy{}03\PYGZhy{}31T21:00:53\PYGZhy{}0400\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{apidoc:get--itinerary--int-id-}\pysigline{\bfcode{GET~}\bfcode{/itinerary/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}}}
Retrieve an itinerary with the id specified from the database. Comes with the associated items and user. Users can only retrieve itineraries that are theirs.

\section{Search Itineraries}
\label{apidoc:search-itineraries}
Users can also search for itineraries from other users using the search endpoint.

\section{Itinerary Ratings}
\label{apidoc:itinerary-ratings}

\section{Items}
\label{apidoc:items}
The items resource represents the individual events contained within an itinerary. This resource can be used to manually add, update, or delete items from a pre-existing itinerary. It can also be used to get detailed information about a specific event.


\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{apidoc:post--itinerary--int-id--item-create}\pysigline{\bfcode{POST~}\bfcode{/itinerary/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}/item/create}}
Creates an item with the specified parameters and adds it to the specified itinerary

\textbf{Request}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{POST} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{itinerary}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{items}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{create}
\PYG{n+nx}{Content}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n+nx}{Type}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{n+nx}{application}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{json}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{Verbatim}

\textbf{Response}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.1} \PYG{l+m+mi}{201} \PYG{n+nx}{Created}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{Verbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}



\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{apidoc:get--itinerary--int-id--item--int-id-}\pysigline{\bfcode{GET~}\bfcode{/itinerary/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}/item/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}}}
Gets the specified item.

\textbf{Response}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.1} \PYG{l+m+mi}{201} \PYG{n+nx}{Created}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{Verbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}



\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{apidoc:put--itinerary--int-id--item--int-id-}\pysigline{\bfcode{PUT~}\bfcode{/itinerary/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}/item/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}}}
Updates an item with new details as specified.

\textbf{Request}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{PUT} \PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{itinerary}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{items}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
\PYG{n+nx}{Content}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n+nx}{Type}\PYG{o}{:} \PYG{n+nx}{application}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n+nx}{json}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{Verbatim}

\textbf{Response}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.1} \PYG{l+m+mi}{200} \PYG{n+nx}{OK}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{Verbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}



\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{apidoc:delete--itinerary--int-id--item--int-id-}\pysigline{\bfcode{DELETE~}\bfcode{/itinerary/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}/item/\textless{}int:id\textgreater{}}}
Deletes the specified item

\textbf{Response}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.1} \PYG{l+m+mi}{204} \PYG{n+nx}{No} \PYG{n+nx}{Content}

\PYG{k+kc}{true}
\end{Verbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Categories}
\label{apidoc:categories}

\section{Directions}
\label{apidoc:directions}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{apidoc:get--maps-directions}\pysigline{\bfcode{GET~}\bfcode{/maps/directions}}
Gets directions from the Google Directions API.

\textbf{Response}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.1} \PYG{l+m+mi}{200} \PYG{n+nx}{OK}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}

\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{Verbatim}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Query Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\textbf{\texttt{origin}} -- The start location. This can be an address string or coordinates. --- required

\item {} 
\textbf{\texttt{destination}} -- The end location. This can be an address string or coordinates. --- required

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{apidoc:get--maps-polyline}\pysigline{\bfcode{GET~}\bfcode{/maps/polyline}}
Gets a Google Encoded polyline for use on a map. See here for more information

\textbf{Response}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nx}{HTTP}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.1} \PYG{l+m+mi}{200} \PYG{n+nx}{OK}

\PYG{n+nx}{fldkjadsfias}\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{n+nx}{odfjsa}\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{n+nx}{ijkfdas}
\end{Verbatim}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Query Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\textbf{\texttt{origin}} -- The start location. This can be an address string or coordinates. --- required

\item {} 
\textbf{\texttt{destination}} -- The end location. This can be an address string or coordinates. --- required

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
